mdRecord.dcterms:title: Pozières Memorial, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Colishaw, William Harrison (British architect, 1869-1957) [work]

Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The memorial lists 14,692 names of British and South African soldiers with no known grave who were killed between 21 March 1918 and 8 August 1918 during the Second Battle of the Somme, in the period known as the Spring Offensive. The cut-off date of 8 August 1918 refers to the start of the period known as the Advance to Victory. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pozieres_Memorial [work]

mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: Near the commune of Pozieres, north of D929 Albert-Bapaume road, just south of the village of Pozières, Somme, Picardy, France
